Oh my, visitors. It will be 10\G for one night. \n<Innkeeper>
I'm sorry, but it doesn't look like you have
There's quite a few people visiting town for
some reason. Luckily, we still have a room or
Years ago we had the main road replaced, hoping it would
draw in more visitors. I'm not sure it was worth the
Sorry, but please stay out of the basement.\n<Innkeeper>
Father! Stop trying to intimidate the guests!\n<Innkeeper>
What? I'm not planning on getting intimate with them! \n<Old Man>
Sorry, my husband's hearing has been getting worse.\n<Innkeeper>
Oh no... Maybe I can do something to help.\n<Holly>
We live near a lake, not the ocean. We don't have any kelp! \n<Old Man>
If I get the right ingredients, I might be able to make
an item to cure his deafness.\n<Holly>
Oh... \.I don't even know if I'm skilled enough to make
Start sidequest to make an item to cure "Deafening".
Can also probably have found/bought the item somewhere,
as well. Since they're old people, they might have
something old as well. Maybe a gift from one of their
children that's useful in some way?
Darn kids these days. They think they can just become some
"adventurers" and that the whole world will come to them. Back
in my day I had to work at both my parent's farm\fi and\fi my
uncle's farm. I didn't get nuthin' for free. I didn't get to go-\n<Old Man>
Father! By the Spirits,\fi please\fi stop complaining
What're ye doin' in here, lad? I've got the inn covered.\n<Kurda>
I've got some booze, if ye feel up to it.\n<Kurda>
O' course! This is my special blend o' Dwarven Firewater!\n<Kurda>
That sounds important. Are you fine sharing it with me?\n<Laun>
Thanks. I'll make sure to enjoy it, then.\n<Laun>
You'd better. It's been aging ever since the city was attacked
Haha! Still a wee bit early for ye? \n<Kurda>
*Cough* Does that mean stronger- *cough* or weaker?\n<Laun>
So, lad. Ye fancy yourself a smith, do ye?\n<Kurda>
Huh?\| Ah, yeah. My adoptive father taught me. I'm not as good as
Hmph. Only a fool would think themselves a genius. At least ye
know not to get ahead o' yourself.\n<Kurda>
Any parent worth the title wouldn't expect their kid to surpass
But... Wouldn't that be good? That would mean you're a good teacher,
or that your kid is talented.\n<Laun>
Mmm. What I mean is\..\..\..\. A parent should know not to put too
much pressure on them. It's a delicate balance, makin' sure they
know you believe in them, without forcing them to be something they're not.\n<Kurda>
Hey Laun. I brought a new party member.\n<Yuu>
Yuu invited some random girl to the party!
You can just call me Mira.\n<Mira>
So there was this fighting ring in town where she was
being forced to fight as a slave. But her owner was forcing
her to lose and when I pointed that out, Artemis used the
distraction to steal some crystal thing and Mira won.\n<Yuu>
Without that fat bastard stopping me, it was easy.\n<Mira>
She's looking for someone that can use magic to remove the slave...\n<Yuu>
So I figured she should come with us!\n<Yuu>
Right...\! Well, if she's as strong as she sounds then she's more then
welcome. I get the feeling we'll be doing even more fights before
we manage to find a good magic user.\n<Laun>
So\..\..\.. it's fine for her to come along?\n<Yuu>
As long as she actually wants to.\n<Laun>
I have nothing better to try.\n<Mira>
I'll take that as a yes.\n<Laun>
I'll be training if you need me.\n<Mira>
\..\..\..\.Guess we should turn in for the day.\n<Laun>
He had some dust on him.\n<Laun>
Just\..\..\..\. What\..\..\..\. Why are you here?\n<Laun>
Oh. I brought a new party member.\n<Yuu>
